arm_group.description: Re-implantation of the coronary arteries into the neo-aortic sinuses through a "trap-door" as far distally as possible on the neo-aorta

arm_group.arm_group_label: Switch non-"trap-door" re-implantation of the coronaries
arm_group.description: Re-implantation of the coronary arteries into the neo-aortic sinuses through small incisions or excision in the sinuses

brief_summary.textblock:
This study involves adolescents operated with arterial switch procedure for transposition of
      the great arteries during the neonatal period. The purpose is to evaluate the coronary
      arteries and direct and indirect findings of coronary artery disease/complications with 3
      tesla magnetic resonance imaging.

clinical_study.brief_title: MRI Study After Arterial Switch Operation in Patients With Transposition of the Great Arteries

detailed_description.textblock:
This study involves adolescents operated with arterial switch procedure for transposition of
      the great arteries during the neonatal period. The patients were operated with two different
      methods of re-implantation of the coronary arteries ("trap-door"/non-"trap-door", see
      description below).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of transposition of the great arteries with or without ventricular
             septum defect

          -  Surgically corrected during neonatal period with arterial switch procedure

        Partial or total Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Heart arrhythmias

          -  Known allergic reaction to gadolinium based contrast media

          -  Reduced renal function (below 60 ml/min/1,73m2)

study_pop.textblock:
Patients 10-15 years old surgically corrected in the neonatal period with arterial switch
        procedure for transposition of the great arteries at Rikshospitalet, OUS, Norway.

arm_group_label: Switch non-"trap-door" re-implantation of the coronaries
intervention.intervention_name: 3 tesla magnetic resonance imaging findings; coronary artery status

arm_group_label: Switch non-"trap-door" re-implantation of the coronaries
intervention.intervention_name: 3 tesla magnetic resonance imaging findings; ventricular function and morphology

clinical_study.official_title: MRI Study After Arterial Switch Operation in Patients With Transposition of the Great Arteries

oversight_info.authority: Norway: Ministry of Health and Care Services

primary_outcome.measure: Direct visualization and status of the coronary arteries, global volume measurements, global and regional strain (myocardial contractility), extravascular, extracellular tissue volume fraction and late enhancement (myocardial fibrosis).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of image quality of direct visualization of the coronary arteries with and without contrast enhanced techniques.
Comparison of coronary artery findings corresponding to indirect functional and morphological findings in MRI and echocardiography in the left and right ventricle.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
